item.title: Report E-2024050528
item.description:
Report E-2024050528

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately seven (7) gallons of material released from four (4) 5-gallon metal pails due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents into four (4) 5-gallon poly pails. The damaged 5-gallon metal pails were overpacked into four (4) 10-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024051054
item.description:
Report X-2024051054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-22T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/7/2024 at approximately 1400, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 83263 at the hub facility in Indianapolis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 1 drum containing flavoring extracts. The bottom of the drum ruptured due to human error, resulting in the spillage of approximately 1 liter of liquid. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.
